raw_comment: I notice there is a higher acceptance rate to these ivy league schools for students with parents that have higher income compared to students with lower. I wonder how many students of each income apply to these schools, and do they all have similar high school educations. I also wonder how this graph would look like in other countries where colleges are more affordable. Personally at my school there are varying students getting the same education with many different income rates. A catchy headline I came up with is, "Are the costs of college preventing students from applying to ivy league schools?"
ace_sentences: I notice that the acceptance rate at Ivy League schools is higher for students whose parents have a higher income than for students whose parents have a lower income.
I wonder how many students of each income group apply to Ivy League schools.
I wonder whether all applicants have similar high school educations.
I wonder how this graph would look in other countries.
In some other countries, colleges are more affordable.
At my school, students have different income levels.
At my school, these students get the same education.
The headline is: Are the costs of college preventing students from applying to Ivy League schools?
